name: The Lake Country House & Spa

reviews.title: Still as Good as ever!!
reviews.text: We stay here every two years for the past 6 years.It gets better and better,the food is constantly of a high standard and impresses my wife every time (and she has worked with Roux,Rhodes & Ramsey!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The junior suites are lovely have their individual querks but are very comfortable and spacious.
reviews.title: Country house getaway

reviews.text: The staff are amazing,our last trip we were so pleased with their attitude helpfulness and enthusiasm,i spoke to chamber maids,receptionists,the girls in the Spa and I was struck by their pleasantness and willingness to help.
reviews.title: Go for Christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa,is a treat, lovely warm pool modern gym equipment and a jacuzzi with views over the private lake which is stocked with trout in which you can fish for a small cost.
reviews.title: Didn't want to come home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a romantic weekend you cant beat the Lakes
reviews.title: Almost Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in November 2009 and had the place pretty much to ourselves and it felt really special. Its relaxed but with good attention to detail. The food was superb with a particularly great cheeseboard and pre dinner appetisers each night..
reviews.title: Luxury without stuffiness, could have stayed much longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the new suites in the adjacent building to the main hotel. Beautiful room, lovely toiletries and yummy homemade shortbread.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its not cheap but worth it for a treat. Would highly recommend and look forward to going back.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with fantastic food

reviews.text: We try and visit Lake Country about once every three months for a night of rest and relaxation.
reviews.title: simply the best all round hotel we've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every time we get a warm welcome for us and our dog.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just had a wonderful 2 night stay at this gorgeous hotel, off the beaten track in beautiful countryside yet easy travelling from local towns.Wonderful relaxing atmosphere, friendly, helpful, quiet staff-nothing was too much trouble. Delicious sophisticated gourmet meals.Our room-River View-was just perfect,overlooking the garden and river beyond.-absolutely spotless bedroom and bathroom [we're fussy!] We spent a wet day in the fantastic spa building-great size pool and had cappucinos in our dressing gowns,used the gym,hot tub[out on a covered veranda overlooking the lake],sauna and had lunch brought over to us-sheer indulgence!! We can't think of a negative thing to say about this gorgeous place.We'll return!
reviews.title: The most perfect escape for relaxation and pampering!

reviews.text: Truely a gem. A complete stress buster. All staff have an easy and friendly manner and exceed expectations at every turn. The food is to die for- a very talented Chef and team. The Spa, blissfully quiet as there's a kids policy, is beautiful. The swimming pool is the clearest I've ever swan in. We've been looking for a hotel where we want to come back to on a regular basis-the search end here!
reviews.title: Truely a gem. A complete stress buster...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after our holiday flights were cancelled due to the volcanic ash just as we were about to leave for the airport. We spent several hours deciding where to go and found this hotel. What a treat. Everybody and everything made this a wonderful break, even the famous Welsh weather was sunshine all the way. All of the reviews are spot on, food, staff, surroundings, spa, rooms, public areas, are all lovely. And having your own hotel dog to walk and throw sticks into the river for was perhaps the most unique aspect of our stay. Thank you Cissie, you certainly earn your keep. And thank you too for our birthday room upgrade, much appreciated.
reviews.title: Thank you, volcanic ash

reviews.text: An old friend and I arranged to meet up, we chose Mid-Wales as we had never been. The Lake Hotel seemed an obvious choice as it had all we were looking for. The beauty of Mid-Wales is the best kept secret!!
reviews.title: I feel like a new woman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel delightful and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The atmosphere was relaxed and friendly. The grounds are magnificent and we were lucky enough to have sunshine throughout our stay.
reviews.title: A fine holtel and super location marred by pushy manager/owner?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked one night here at the last minute to celebrate my partners birthday. We don't often stay in luxury hotels so this was a treat for us both. We were not disappointed. From the welcome at reception to the service throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed the pool, sauna and hot tub (which we had to ourselves), a walk in the grounds and a fabulous dinner. Breakfast was also very good. On checking out we noticed an army of cleaners at work; no wonder the rooms are spotless. Our room was actually a suite with a good bathroom and lovely comfortable bed. My partner, normally a poor sleeper and early riser slept through to an almost normal time!!We hope to re-visit later this year.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a secluded location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel as a last minute for a break for myself and my partner via the internet.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous - a fantastic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time we arrived at the hotel until the time we left, we were treated fantastically and made very welcome. Our room was upgraded to a suite which was fantastic, very roomy, and we couldn't fault anything. The hotel is a ittle off the beaten track but that doesn't mean that it's not worth it when you get there. It is a little (or hugh) haven away from everything. All the staff were really helpful, fantastic wine, fantastic food, fantastic accomodation, fantastic grounds.
reviews.title: Possibly the best hotel we've ever stayed in!

reviews.text: Well worth the money.
reviews.title: Idyllic country retreat

reviews.text: The spa was great - lovely to get in the hot tub on the decking and chill.
reviews.title: Excellent conference location

description: The Lake Country House Hotel is a 4 star hotel set in the Heart of Mid Wales and is the perfect destination for a luxury hotel break or romantic getaway. The Spa offers a range of Heath and Beauty treatments and is equipped with and indoor pool, sauna and Jacuzzi overlooking the lake. Game Fishing and golf are available on site and there is a good range of other golf courses in the area. Horse riding, the Elan Valley and of course the Brecon Beacons are all near by.An air of elegance and calm informality pervades this exquisitely furnished Welsh country house hotel. Standing serenely in its own fifty acres of parkland, with sweeping lawns, rhododendron lined pathways and riverside walks, this magnificent mid wales hotel is comfort epitomised.The country house itself is an architectural bagatelle, begun in 1840 and remodeled in 1900.
